#Text=Santa Clarita
#Text=Santa
#Text=Clarita
#Text=is the third largest city in Los Angeles County in Southern California .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The closest and most convenient airport is in Burbank .
#Text=Other nearby airports include Los Angeles International Airport , Ontario , and Orange County .
#Text=Supershuttle and Primetime are shared-ride vans which serve the Santa Clarita area from LAX .
#Text=Stand under the orange " shared ride vans " sign in the center concrete island outside the LAX airport .

column1: #Text=Tell a customer service representative that you need a ride to Santa Clarita .
#Text=They are easy to identify by their blue jackets ( Supershuttle ) or red jackets ( Primetime ) .
#Text=If no representative is available , then flag down a blue van ( Supershuttle ) or red van ( Primetime ) with a " Santa Clarita " placard in the windshield .
#Text=Approximate cost is $ 30 per person .
#Text=Approximate time to Santa Clarita is 1 hour .
#Text=The cheapest way to get to Santa Clarita from LAX is to use Metrolink .
#Text=Stand under the green " FlyAway , Buses and Long-Distance Vans " sign in the center concrete island outside the LAX airport .

column1: #Text=Board a blue FlyAway bus heading to Union Station ( there are FlyAway buses going to Van Nuys and Westwood as well ) .
#Text=It will cost you $ 4 one-way ( a 30-minute trip ) .
#Text=The blue FlyAway is a large charter-style bus , and is occasionally not labeled .
#Text=FlyAway buses operate every half hour , 24 hours a day .
#Text=If you are boarding at the airport , you will not be charged until you get to your destination .
#Text=At Union Station follow the Metrolink signs .
#Text=Walk to the Antelope Valley Line ( typically platform 4B , but varies so check signage ) in Union Station .
#Text=Inside the terminal is an automated kiosk for purchasing tickets .
#Text=One-way tickets for the AV Line are $ 7.50 , or $ 10 for a day pass on the weekends .
#Text=There is a discount for seniors , students , and people with documented disabilities , which generally includes any disability that would prevent them from walking or driving a car .
#Text=The travel time is approximately 1 hour , which cuts off as much as 45 minutes with the traffic conditions at times .
#Text=By train
#Text=The closest full-service Amtrak station is Los Angeles Union Station .
#Text=From there , you would take the Metrolink Antelope Valley line up to Santa Clarita .
#Text=At Union Station follow the Metrolink signs .
#Text=Walk to the Antelope Valley Line in Union Station ( typically platform 4B , but varies so check signage ) .
#Text=Inside the terminal is an automated kiosk for purchasing tickets .
#Text=One way tickets are $ 7.50 , or $ 10 for a day pass on the weekends .
#Text=There are discounts for seniors and people with disabilities , which reduces the one-way ticket price to $ 3.75 .
#Text=The student discount reduces the one-way ticket price to $ 5.75 .
#Text=The travel time is approximately 1 hour , which cuts off as much as 45 minutes with the traffic conditions at times .
#Text=By car
#Text=From Downtown L.A. or other southern cities take Interstate 5 North , which is called " the 5 freeway " locally .
#Text=Santa Clarita starts with Lyons Avenue/Pico Canyon Exit and ends around Hasley Canyon Exit .
#Text=Slightly West of the 5 freeway in Los Angeles is the 101 North to the 170 North which ends at the 5 North freeway .
#Text=In South West Los Angeles the 405 North also connects to the 5 freeway North .
#Text=From the North East , the 14 ( Antelope Valley ) freeway South will take you to Santa Clarita , exiting at Soledad Canyon .
#Text=By taxi
#Text=Southland Yellow Cab Co +1 661 723-2227
#Text=United Taxi of Los Angeles +1 661 267-9850
#Text=Yellow Cab of Santa Clarita +1 661 260-2227
#Text=Yellow Star Cab Santa Clarita +1 661 288-7800
#Text=By bus
#Text=There are several Santa Clarita Transit bus routes throughout the city .
#Text=Full fare for a single ride is $ 1 , with children 5 and under free .
#Text=Adults over 60 ride for a reduced fare of $.50/single ride .
#Text=Transfers are free .
#Text=By bicycle
#Text=Santa Clarita is known for its wealth of bike paths and paseos .
#Text=You can easily get around by bicycle as everything is connected by paseos where you can avoid waiting for traffic lights .
#Text=A map of the bike paths is available at the City of Santa Clarita 's main website .
#Text=By horse
#Text=There is a large equestrian community in Santa Clarita .
#Text=There are horse trails throughout the city with plans to construct more in the future .
#Text=The horse trails can be found on the following map supplied from the City of Santa Clarita 's website .
#Text=By train
#Text=On weekdays , four bus lines have service to/from the Metrolink station that connects Santa Clarita to Los Angeles .
#Text=Routes 501-504 .
#Text=They are designed to run for commuters , but work great for those wanting easy/fast access to Los Angeles without the hassle of traffic .
#Text=Details of times the run and stops are on the Santa Clarita Transit website .
#Text=There are two Metrolink Stations in Santa Clarita operating on the Antelope Valley Line which ends at downtown Los Angeles ( Union Station ) .
#Text=From there you can connect to other Metrolink train lines or LA 's subway/bus system as well as Amtrak or the Van Nuys Flyaway buses with service to the LAX airport :
#Text=Jan Heidt Newhall Metrolink Station , 24300
#Text=Railroad Ave. Directions : From the 5 Fwy . , exit Lyons Ave. Go East on Lyons to San Fernando Rd .
#Text=Go South on San Fernando Rd . to Market .
#Text=Go East on Market to Railroad Ave. There are 150 parking spaces available , and there is no fee for parking .
#Text=Santa Clarita Metrolink Station , 22122
#Text=Soledad Canyon Rd . Directions : From the 5 Fwy . , exit Valencia Ave. Go East on Valencia Ave. Valencia becomes Soledad Canyon Road .
#Text=There are 350 parking spaces available , and there is no fee for parking .
#Text=Bike lockers are available .
#Text=See
#Text=Six Flags Magic Mountain .
#Text=Open since 1971 , is the leading attraction in Santa Clarita .
#Text=Movie buffs will recognize this park as " Wally World " in the 1983 film National Lampoon 's Vacation .
#Text=Buy your tickets online at their website and you 'll usually get a deal like $ 10 off or buy one get one free Parking is $ 17 for self parking and $ 30 for valet .

#Text=Six Flags Magic Mountain , the Thrill Capital of the World , firmly holds the coveted " Coaster Capital of the World " crown — with a total of 18 roller coasters — more than any other theme park on the planet .
#Text=Six Flags Hurricane Harbor .
#Text=Adjacent to Six Flags Magic Mountain is its sister Park Six Flags Hurricane Harbor .
#Text=This tropical themed water park provides an entire day of fun for the whole family !
#Text=The attraction lineup features more than 23 slides and activities that keep you cool in the summer months .
